item.title: Simulation View of Causality
item.description: div.blue pre.r { background-color:azure; } div.blue pre { background-color:blue; } I try to present an intuitive account of causal reasoning and the important notion of causal conditioning without resorting to some of the formalities of the rules of do-calculus, d-separation and the like. First a little background to setup our running example. The power generated by photovoltaic solar power plants is decreased by not an insignificant when dirt and other particulates collect on the panels.
